meanings.definition: A lazy, idle, or worthless person.
meanings.sent1: The lurdan slept all day without doing any work.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a lurdan and help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The lurdan found a way to avoid any responsibility.
meanings.sent4: His laziness turned him into a lurdan, just lying around all day.
meanings.sent5: The lurdan's lack of motivation was evident to everyone around.

meanings.definition: To act in a lazy or idle manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to lurdan around instead of finishing her tasks.
meanings.sent2: Please don't lurdan when there's work to be done.
meanings.sent3: He chose to lurdan about rather than help with the project.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to lurdan its way through the day, napping in the sun.
meanings.sent5: I could see him lurdan through the afternoon, avoiding any productive activity.
